articleContent.title: Chord: Minor 7th in A# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Minor 7th in A# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The A# minor 7th chord, in the shape of C on the guitar, is a four-note chord consisting of the notes A#, C#, E# (F), and G#. It is a minor chord with the added seventh interval. This chord creates a mellow and jazzy sound that can add depth and emotion to your music.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (A#)
- Minor 3rd (C#)
- Perfect 5th (E#/F)
- Minor 7th (G#)

## Musical Flavor
The A# minor 7th chord in the shape of C is commonly used in jazz, funk, and soul music. It has a smooth and sophisticated sound, adding a touch of melancholy and complexity to chord progressions. This chord can create a sense of tension and release, making it versatile for both rhythm and lead guitar parts.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the A# minor 7th chord in the shape of C:
1. **"Fly Me to the Moon"** by Frank Sinatra
2. **"Cissy Strut"** by The Meters
3. **"Don't Know Why"** by Norah Jones

Feel free to explore these songs to hear how the A# minor 7th chord in the shape of C is used in different musical contexts.
